result.execSummary:
The defendant Steffon I Reich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 8 days sentence credit.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Restitution (payable to Hartland Police Dept.) is to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Obtain GED/HSED.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the victim/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Case 15CF448 is dismissed and read in.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.  May be released for birth of child and child care.
Commencing FORTHWITH.
LAST 6 MONTHS ARE STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steffon I Reich in court with Attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

7 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 8 days)
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  4 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  4 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  

____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling-obtain GHED/HSED 
____No contact with: victim/businesses listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $240.00 to Hartland Police Department (to be paid within 1st 6 months of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 12 MONTHS,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions (may be released for birth of child and child care) to commence forthwith - LAST 6 MONTHS STAYED- to be used at agent's discretion.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
